data.title: Anthony Davis just joined this group of former UK players to win an NBA title
data.meta_description: Kentucky basketball alumni Anthony Davis, Rajon Rondo and Frank Vogel just won an NBA championship with the Los Angeles Lakers.
data.text:
LEXINGTON — Anthony Davis, Rajon Rondo and the Los Angeles Lakers have come out on top in the battle of former Kentucky basketball stars in the NBA finals.

Former Wildcats Tyler Herro and Bam Adebayo will have to wait at least another year to join the list of UK NBA champions after their Miami Heat lost the series in six games to the Lakers.

With the Lakers' win, Davis becomes the first John Calipari-coached UK player to win an NBA title. Rondo, a Louisville native, earned his second championship ring, becoming the fourth former Wildcat to win multiple NBA titles as a player.

Here is a full list of the exclusive club of UK stars turned NBA champions Davis just joined.

Derek Anderson — Miami Heat (2006)

Anthony Davis — Los Angeles Lakers (2020)

Kevin Grevey — Washington Bullets (1978)

Cliff Hagan — St. Louis Hawks (1958)

Jodie Meeks — Toronto Raptors (2019)

Nazr Mohammed — San Antonio Spurs (2005)

Paul Noel — Rochester Royals (1951)

Tayshaun Prince — Detroit Pistons (2004)

Frank Ramsey — Boston Celtics (1957, 1959, 1960, 1961, 1962, 1963, 1964)

Pat Riley — Los Angeles Lakers (1972)

Rick Robey — Boston Celtics (1981)

Rajon Rondo — Boston Celtics (2008), Los Angeles Lakers (2020)

Larry Steele — Portland Trailblazers (1977)

Lou Tsioropoulos — Boston Celtics (1957, 1959)

Antoine Walker — Miami Heat (2006)

Previously: John Calipari analyzes every former Kentucky basketball star in the 2020 NBA Finals

The Lakers are coached by former UK student manager Frank Vogel. He is the second UK alum to win an NBA title as a coach, joining Riley, who coached the Lakers to titles in 1982, 1985, 1987 and 1988 and the Heat to a title in 2006.
